body_html:
Ah, the error about creator is some issue in latest master, unrealted to this change. Although, there is an __init__ creatd on the cside. But that should be handle-able. Maybe

Edit: hmmm, even if I rename Variable.__init__ to Variable.__cside__init__, and then rename a new method Variable.__pyside__init__ to Variable.__init__, a the bottmo of variable.py, it still seems to call the cside init method first. So, not so obvious how to change this...

cside <slot wrapper '__init__' of 'torch._C._VariableBase' objects>
pyside <function Variable.__pyside__init__ at 0x7f7fe29fc7b8>
__init__ <function Variable.__pyside__init__ at 0x7f7fe29fc7b8>
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "testatt1.py", line 33, in <module>
    [0, 0, 0.2]
RuntimeError: Variable data has to be a tensor, but got list

body:
Ah, the error about `creator` is some issue in latest `master`, unrealted to this change. Although, there is an `__init__` creatd on the cside. But that should be handle-able. Maybe

Edit: hmmm, even if I rename `Variable.__init__` to `Variable.__cside__init__`, and then rename a new method `Variable.__pyside__init__` to `Variable.__init__`, a the bottmo of variable.py, it still seems to call the cside init method first.  So, not so obvious how to change this...

```
cside <slot wrapper '__init__' of 'torch._C._VariableBase' objects>
pyside <function Variable.__pyside__init__ at 0x7f7fe29fc7b8>
__init__ <function Variable.__pyside__init__ at 0x7f7fe29fc7b8>
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "testatt1.py", line 33, in <module>
    [0, 0, 0.2]
RuntimeError: Variable data has to be a tensor, but got list
```
